page.title: 06Village Life, West Overton.
page.content: I am retired now. I get up and do my housework. After that I do some gardening if it is fine. Sometimes I go to play golf at Marlborough Golf Club. If it's wet, I do some knitting or some jobs indoors. At lunchtime I listen to the Archers on the radio, before doing some cooking. Sometimes I go into Marlborough to help in the Oxfam shop and do a bit of shopping. In the evening after dinner I usually do the Daily Telegraph crossword puzzle and watch television for a while, if there is anything interesting. Then I go to bed. I read a chapter of my library book before I go to sleep. I get my books from the mobile library van which comes round the villages every two weeks.
